channel.title: Flowering through objects

item.title: Flowering through objects
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Use region clipping instead of just the walk to method. Walk to does no object checks what so ever. It just moves your character to the x, y specified.

if (Region.getClipping(c.getX() - 1, c.getY(), c.heightLevel, -1, 0)) { c.getPA().walkTo(-1, 0); } else if (Region.getClipping(c.getX() + 1, c.getY(), c.heightLevel, 1, 0)) { c.getPA().walkTo(1, 0); } else if (Region.getClipping(c.getX(), c.getY() - 1, c.heightLevel, 0, -1)) { c.getPA().walkTo(0, -1); } else if (Region.getClipping(c.getX(), c.getY() + 1, c.heightLevel, 0, 1)) { c.getPA().walkTo(0, 1); }

That was shamelessly ripped from a tutorial…
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/385236-pi-better-mithril-seeds-updated.html

Read full topic

item.title: Flowering through objects
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

So, i’m not that famliar with PI. But for some reason when flowering the flowers will make you walk through an object and the flower will replace that object. So basically they can delete objects.

if (itemId == 299 && (c.seedtimer != 1)) {
			if (c.isGamble != 1) {
				c.sendMessage("You need to purchase a gambling rank before you can host games.");
				return;
			}
			flowers = randomflower();
			flowerX += c.absX;
			flowerY += c.absY;
			c.getPA().object(flowers, c.absX, c.absY, 0, 10);
			c.sendMessage("You plant the seed...");
			c.seedtimer += 1;
			c.getPA().walkTo(-1, 0); // What makes you walk through objects.
			c.getItems().deleteItem(299, c.getItems().getItemSlot(299), 1);
			c.getDH().sendDialogues(91, -1);
		}

I was thinking about adding a check around it to see if you will obstruct objects but not to sure on PI’s methods. Any help/ideas?

Thanks.

Read full topic
